channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: Afghanistan: Biden says another Kabul airport attack likely
item.description: The US president says commanders have told him another attack could happen within the next 36 hours.

item.title: Herat under the Taliban: residents on the new rulers
item.description: People in Afghanistan’s third-largest city, Herat, explain how life has changed in recent weeks.

item.title: Afghanistan: British ambassador home as last UK troops leave
item.description: Sir Laurie Bristow arrives on one of the last flights carrying UK personnel back from Afghanistan.

item.title: Afghanistan: Black Hawks and Humvees - military kit now with the Taliban
item.description: As the insurgents swept through Afghanistan they inherited an arsenal of US-made equipment.

item.title: Sabyasachi Mukherjee: Wanderlust collection was about India
item.description: Indian fashion designer Sabyasachi Mukherjee was criticised after he teamed up with high street retailer H&M.

item.title: Shannon Singh: ‘People say I don't look Indian enough'
item.description: The former Love Island contestant speaks about the online abuse she’s received.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Afghanistan's Paralympians arrival sends out 'message of hope'
item.description: The safe arrival of Afghanistan's Paralympic athletes in Tokyo sends out "a very strong message of hope", says the International Paralympic Committee.

item.title: Covid origin: US spy agencies publish 'inconclusive' report
item.description: The office that oversees US spy agencies could not establish how the coronavirus pandemic began.

item.title: Shein: China fashion giant investigates 'false' anti-Uyghur job ads
item.description: Shein said it did not fund or approve adverts that suggested some ethnic minorities need not apply.

item.title: Covid-19: The Indian children who have forgotten how to read and write
item.description: Schools in India have been closed for more than a year, with learning outcomes falling drastically.

item.title: Jo Ferrari: Wanted Thai police chief surrenders after manhunt
item.description: The former officer, accused of torturing a suspect to death, spoke at an unusual press conference.

item.title: Afghanistan's Uyghurs fear the Taliban, and now China too
item.description: Members of the ethnic group say they fear the Taliban takeover could bring China to their doorstep.

item.title: Japan suspends 1.6 million Moderna doses over contamination fears
item.description: About 1.63 million vials are withheld after 'foreign objects' were detected in some doses.

item.title: Indian-American gay couples find new forms of union amid stigma
item.description: Although gay marriage is legal in the US, Indian-American couples struggle to find priests to marry them.

item.title: Afghan music school falls silent under Taliban rule
item.description: As the new regime bans music, the head of Afghanistan's national music school says students are scared.

item.title: Afghanistan: Where will refugees go after Taliban takeover?
item.description: Thousands of people are scrambling to flee Afghanistan after the Taliban took control of the country.

item.title: Bilal Sarwary: 'The plane hit the tower and all our lives changed'
item.description: Afghan journalist Bilal Sarwary was selling carpets when 9/11 happened. From that day on, everything changed.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'The pain of watching my country burn from afar'
item.description: Hundreds of Afghan have taken refuge in India but they are worried about their families back home.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'undefeated' Panjshir Valley - an hour from Kabul
item.description: The Panjshir Valley has been a flashpoint in Afghanistan's turbulent history - now it's happening again.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The Games with a record number of LGBTQ athletes
item.description: As the Paralympics get under way, athletes reflect on how much more inclusive the Games have become.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: The lowdown on being disabled in Japan
item.description: From moon riders to job quotas, three residents give the lowdown on being disabled in Japan.

item.title: How Afghanistan rattled Asia and emboldened China
item.description: US VP Kamala Harris tries to reassure Asian allies, as many ask: can they still trust America?

item.title: Kamala Harris joins diplomatic charm offensive in South East Asia
item.description: The US vice-president's trip to the region falls in the shadow of a chaotic withdrawal from Afghanistan.
